title: Suppressing script issue
author: spisarau
body_snippet:
In our company to access corporate resources SSO method of authentication is used. But when I try to access resources via mRemoteNG for some of them I am not able to get access. I receive authentication issue. 
I investigated this issue and  found out that the cause of it is enabled ScriptErrorsSuppressed option for WebBrowser component. After I disabled it, I received some script errors, but I could access corporate recourses without any further errors.

iterations.description: The user is experiencing SSO authentication issues because 'ScriptErrorsSuppressed' is hardcoded to true for the IE rendering engine; making this configurable will resolve the issue while maintaining default behavior.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The user is experiencing SSO authentication issues because 'ScriptErrorsSuppressed' is hardcoded to true for the IE rendering engine; making this configurable will resolve the issue while maintaining default behavior.
Approach: Add a new boolean property 'ScriptErrorsSuppressed' (defaulting to true) to ConnectionInfo and its inheritance chain, and update HTTPBase.cs to use this property instead of the hardcoded value.
